snippet: Scientists from Harvard and Yale found that chimpanzees would give up raw food on the possibility that it might emerge cooked later. [Article plus video.]
abstract: Scientists at Yale and Harvard find that chimpanzees have mental ability to cook; their research shows chimps would give up raw slice of sweet potato in hand for prospect of cooked slice of sweet potato a while later; findings appear in journal Proceedings of the Royal Society B.
